name: Financial Flow Tracing
description: Traces financial flows through corporate ownership, individual profiles, and motivation analysis. Based on ICIJ Panama/Pandora Papers methodology and OCCRP Laundromat investigations. Financial evidence requires recursive ownership tracing.

task.purpose: Map all parties and the nature of the financial relationship in "{evidence.description}". Financial investigations start with identifying who is paying whom, how much, and why.
keyTasks: Identify all parties in the financial relationship (payer, payee, intermediaries).
Determine the nature of the financial relationship (funding, payment, investment, grant, loan).
Note amounts, dates, and stated purposes.
Determine whether any party is a company or an individual for downstream tracing.
task.endState: All parties identified, transaction type classified, amounts/dates/purposes documented.

requiredOutputs.description: All parties in the financial relationship
Type: funding, payment, investment, grant, loan
Whether any party is a company
Whether any party is an individual

task.purpose: Trace ownership chains and financial profiles for parties in "{evidence.description}". For companies: trace to ultimate beneficial owner. For individuals: map relevant financial relationships and check PEP/sanctions status.
keyTasks: For company parties: search corporate registries (OpenCorporates, jurisdiction-specific registries). Extract officers, directors, shareholders. If owner is another company, trace one more level. Identify ultimate beneficial owner (UBO). Check for shell company indicators: nominee directors, secrecy jurisdiction, no visible operations.
For individual parties: identify other known financial relationships relevant to the investigation topic. Check for PEP (Politically Exposed Person) status. Search for sanctions.
Document the corporate structure or individual financial profile.
Flag any opacity or obstruction in the tracing process.
task.endState: Ownership traced to UBO (companies) or financial profile mapped (individuals). Shell company indicators, PEP status, and sanctions checked.

requiredOutputs.description: Whether any individual is a PEP

task.purpose: Determine what financial interest each party has in the outcome being investigated. Financial relationships only matter if they create incentives that could bias outcomes.
keyTasks: Determine what financial interest each party has in the outcome/claim being investigated.
Research whether similar financial relationships have influenced outcomes in other cases.
Check for patterns: does this funder consistently fund research that supports their commercial interests?
Assess the magnitude of financial interest relative to the party's overall finances.
task.endState: Financial interests mapped to investigation outcomes. Influence patterns documented. Funding bias patterns identified or ruled out.

requiredOutputs.description: Patterns of financial influence on outcomes
Whether a funding bias pattern was found

task.purpose: Cross-reference all discovered financial information against public records and regulatory disclosures. Discrepancies between disclosed and discovered relationships are high-value signals.
keyTasks: Cross-reference the financial information against public records, tax filings, and regulatory disclosures.
Check for discrepancies between disclosed and discovered financial relationships.
Validate key financial claims through independent sources.
task.endState: Financial information cross-referenced against public records. Discrepancies documented. Validation sources cataloged.

requiredOutputs.description: Discrepancies found between disclosed and discovered info
